word:
145. The principles of health reform, . . . which are adopted by him who gives the word of God to others, will have a molding influence upon 
                                                                           39
his work, and upon those with whom he labors. If his principles are wrong, he can and will misrepresent the truth to others; if he accepts the truth which appeals to reason rather than to perverted appetite, his influence for the right will be decided.-- S. T., No. 7, p. 41.
